Reading: Where Do I Go For Health Care?
When you are well, see your doctor for a checkup. Your doctor will look for problems you do not see or feel. Finding a health problem early may save your life.
When you are sick, go to your primary care center. Your primary care center is the place to go for all your basic health care needs. Call your primary care center to make an appointment.
When you have an emergency, go to the hospital emergency room or call 911. An Emergency is when you have a serious medical problem that needs to be addressed right away.
Speaking: Setting Up an Appointment
Hello, health center, how may I help you?
Hello, this is Fatima Tuma. I want to make an appointment.
How do you spell your name?
T U M A
What is the problem?
I have a headache and sore throat.
Do you have a fever?
No, I don\'t.
Okay, come in tomorrow at 10AM
Thank you
Reading: What will the doctor ask me?
What are your symptoms? Before you go to the doctor, practice describing your symptoms in English. Practice with a friend or a family member.

What medicine do you take? Before you go to the doctor, write down the names of medicines you take and how much you take each day. Give this list to your doctor. Or you can bring your medicines with you and show them to the doctor.
What is your health history? Your health history is the health problems you have now or had in the past. Your doctor will always ask you to fill out a health history form.
Reading: What will I ask the doctor?
Be sure you understand the answers to these questions before you leave your appointment.
What is my main problem?
What do I need to do/how do I take my medication?
Why is it important for me to do this?
What if I am getting worse?
How do I get my medicine? Where do I go?
What are the side effects of my medicine?
It is your doctors job to clearly explain the answers to these questions.
It is your job to be sure you understand the answers before you leave the doctors office.
Speaking: Getting Medicine
Hello, my name is Dr.Watson. How may I help you?
I have pain in my back.
Do you have other symptoms?
Yes, it hurts when I walk
What is causing my back pain?
I can give you some medicine to help. Take it two times a day.
How long should I take the medicine?
Take all the medicine. It should last about one week.
Thank you, Doctor.

Speaking: Over the Counter Medication
Hello, how can I help you?
I need to find over the counter medication for allergies.
What are your symptoms?
I have a headache and I sneeze often.
Here is a medicine that works for many people. Try this medicine.
Will this medicine cause side effects?
This label says the medicine may make you feel sleepy.
Is there a medicine that will not make me sleepy?
Yes, try this one.
Thank you.
Reading: What is healthy eating?
Healthy eating means the body is getting the food it needs to stay healthy. Healthy eating can prevent obesity and other health problems.

Other health problems that can be avoided or lessened by healthy eating: Diabetes, High Cholesterol, Osteoporosis, Cancer, Heart Disease and Stroke, High Blood Pressure, Depression, and Eating Disorders.
Reading: More Variety in Your Diet
To stay healthy you need to eat foods from the 5 food groups. These 5 food groups are Fruits, Dairy, Protein, Vegetables, and Grains.
Reading: Eat More Fruits and Vegetables
One of the best things you can do for your health is eat more fruits and vegetables. Fruits and vegetables give you the fiber and vitamins your body needs to stay healthy.
People should work to eat 2 servings of fruit and 5 servings of vegetables each day.

Examples of a serving are: 1 small apple, 1 large orange, 1 cup of leafy greens(lettuce, spinach, kale), 1 small bell pepper, 1/2 a cup of berries(blueberries, strawberries, grapes), 2 medium carrots.
Speaking: Fruits and Vegetables
What fruits do you like to eat?
I like to eat oranges and apples.
What vegetables do you like to eat?
I like to eat broccoli and carrots.
Do you like to eat spinach?
No, I do not like to eat spinach. Do you?
No, I do not like spinach either.
Do you like to eat strawberries?
Yes, strawberries are my favorite food
